result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Dale T Wied was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Defendant is Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Sentence credit of 29 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Perform Alcohol Assessment.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with the witness listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dale T Wied in court, in custody, with Attorney Jonathan LaVoy.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Lavoy makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 29 days)          **CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE**
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*DRIVER'S LICENSE REVOCATION:   36 MONTHS 
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: witness listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Attend Victim Impact Panel

FINE:  $3,801.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation-to be forwarded to City of Brookfield Police Department) 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
 
**Court orders Washington County presentence investigation sealed**
Treatment letters and Character letters, filed by Atty LaVoy.
PSI from Washington County filed by Atty LaVoy. Cover letter dated 01/19/15 attached.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dale T Wied in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rumpf requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on November 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Dale T Wied in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a not guilty plea to charges on amended information.  Attorney Rumpf requests a short adjournment.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/30/14.
Hearing on October 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring and only to be released to WCS for the SCRAM monitoring.   Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program. Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint and not to discuss the case with his wife.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
